FERMENTABLE.NAME: Abbey Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: High degree of modification of both proteins and starches. Excellent friability. Low beta-glucan values. Highly acidic. Highly malt-aromatic. Adds deep-amber to red-brown colour,maltiness, body, and mouthfeel to finished beer. Promotes flavour stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acidulated Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Lowers the pH level of the wort, for better fermentation and improved flavor stability. Yields an acid rate of 50-55%.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Malt Extract, dry light
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale coloured dry malt extract, for general purpose use. Use as a base malt for any lager or ale.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Malt Extract, dry dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark coloured dry malt extract, for general purpose use. Use in any medium to dark coloured beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Malt Extract, oat
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Enhances body and flavour of beers by adding texture and a warm, grainy flavour. Excellent in stouts, porters and other robust British ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Malt Extract, wheat
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use alone, or with specialty malts, to brew wheat beers of all styles. Excellent for boosting gravity or enhancing mouthfeel, body and foam.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Malt Extract, liquid munich
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Made from 50% Munich Malt and 50% Base Malt to produce a very rich, malty, amber colored extract.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A mildly kilned malt that will add a strong malt aroma and deep colour when used as a specialty malt. This malt can make up to 100% of the grain bill, but it is fairly low in surplus diastatic enzymes. At a rate as low as 10% it will lend a distinct, almost exaggerated malt aroma and flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to increase body of beer.Typically used in stouts and porters for body and head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, roasted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in the production of dry or bitter Stouts and other dark beers,or in small amounts for colour adjustment in lighter beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A toasted malt that provides a warm bread or biscuit flavour and aroma. It will also lend a garnet-brown colour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavour is more intense than Chocolate malt. Adds a strong burnt coffee flavor - suitable for stouts and porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavour. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium caramel malt. Imparts fuller body and improved malt aroma to dark beers, particularly German altbiers, stouts, bocks and porters. Sustitute for Belgian Biscuit Malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark caramel malt with aromatic properties. Adds deep red color and aroma. Substitute for Belgian Special B.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carabelge Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Golden-brown, slightly aromatic kernels. Provides finished beer with full, rounded aroma, depth of colour, and a firm, creamy head.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carabohemian Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark golden-brown, this 2 row spring barley has slightly aromatic kernels. They contribute a dark-amber to deep-coppery colour to the finished beer. Adds mouthfeel as well as a rich malt accent to the brew.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special T1 Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A unique de-husked roasted barley malt, adds aroma, colour and body, with a mild and smooth flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special T2 Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A unique de-husked roasted barley malt, adds aroma, colour and body, with a mild and smooth flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special T3 Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A unique de-husked roasted barley malt, adds aroma, colour and body, with a mild and smooth flavour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carahell Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light colored caramel malt. Adds body, rounder flavour, deep saturated colour and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramalt Dark Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Made from green malt - imparts a light malt flavour and slight hue. Suitable for light ales, lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich I Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, deep saturated colour and aroma. Used to create Bocks, Dark beers, Oktoberfest beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich II Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, deep saturated colour and aroma. Used to create Bocks, Dark beers, Oktoberfest beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich III Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, deep saturated colour and aroma. Used to create Bocks, Dark beers, Oktoberfest beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Great addition for the non-mash brewer brewer to enhance a beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Gorgeous crystal malt, full body and aroma, deep red colour. Red ales and lagers, Scottish ales, Bocks, and Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Heritage Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Made from 100% Maris Otter. Distinctive medium intensity caramel, toffee flavour, Improves head retention, aroma and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Malt, pale
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Distinctive yet subtle caramel, toffee flavour, Also improves head retention, aroma and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Malt, medium
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Distinctive medium intensity caramel, toffee flavour, Improves head retention, aroma and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Malt, dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Distinctive intense caramel, toffee flavour,with hints of burnt, roasted flavours. Improves head retention, aroma and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds strong coffee flavor to your beer. The flavour is sharp and somewhat acrid. Used in Porters and sweet Stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt, pale
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds strong coffee flavor to your beer. The flavour is sharp and somewhat acrid. Used in Porters and sweet Stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maize, flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmalted gelatinised corn. Used to add fermentables without increasing body. Use in light bodied ales and lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Golden Promise Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Golden Promise, an early-maturing spring barley, is the Scottish equivalent of Maris Otter. Though brewers north of the English border claim that its sweet, clean flavor is superior to Maris Otter. Golden Promise malt has a depth of flavor that makes it the ideal base malt for both UK and USA-style IPAs. Golden Promise is also used extensively by premium whisky distilleries such as The Macallan.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Halcyon Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Halcyon is a barley variety that was bred from Maris Otter and Sargent. Tends to produce a sharper wort than Maris Otter. Floor malted malts have a depth of flavour unmatched by modern methods.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maris Otter Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Maris Otter is an English thoroughbred and this winter barley variety is still the favored choice of many UK cask ale brewers. In the field, its yield has been surpassed hugely by more modern varieties, so it has to be grown on contract for the maltster each year by selected farmers. The resulting malt is typically described as having a rich, nutty flavor. Performance in the brewhouse is predictable and consistent with excellent run-offs.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoiden Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Gives you the rich decocted malt flavours that full bodied European lagers have (without having to go to the trouble of decocting).

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Mild Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Produces sweet and flavourful worts, being slightly darker than regular ale malt it\'s perfect for milds and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich I Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Munich malt. Used as a base for many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich II Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker Munich malt. Used as a base for many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds a silky smoothness to Stouts and Belgian Ales

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Enhances body and flavour of dark beers by adding texture and a warm, grainy flavour to stouts, porters and other robust British ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Golden Naked Oats
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Golden Naked Oats will deliver a deep golden hue with light caramel flavors to the finished beer as well as a creamy, satin finish.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Optic Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Popular and well established, hardy spring malting variety that makes good quality malt, grown extensively in Scotland.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Ale Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Authentic German ale malt for all beer types. Produces suberb lagers, Pilsners and Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Perle Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A very popular winter barley with British breweries. Sits between Golden Promise and Maris Otter in terms of flavour profile.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Peat Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A robust smokey malt that provides a peaty, smoky flavor. Used in scottish ales and wee heavy ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt for all pilsners, lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds distinctive earthy, spicy rye flavour and aroma. Tends to gum up the mash, so caution required when sparging.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Caramel Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Creates beers that tend to be sweet and malty with a full mouthfeel. The warm wholemeal biscuit flavors are allied to characteristic rye spiciness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Enhanced aroma of dark, top fermented beers, as well as improved colour.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Smoked flavor and aroma, typical for this classic German style

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: The darkest of the Belgian crystal malts. Imparts a heavy caramel taste and is often credited with the raisin-like flavours of some Belgian Abbey ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special Roast
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Complex flavored Biscuit-style malt. With its characteristic and bold sourdough flavor, it will contribute an exciting layer of flavor to Nut Brown Ales, Porters and other dark beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Victory Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Biscuit Malt. Well suited for Nut Brown Ales and other dark beers. Its clean flavor makes it equally well suited for ales and lagers alike. Use in small amounts to add complexity to lighter colored ales and lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to create full-bodied, golden-colored, smooth-tasting beers such as Lagers, MÃ¤rzenbier, Maibock, festival beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Caramel Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Promotes body and wheat malt aroma with enhanced colour. Used particularly in Dunkelweizen and Hefeweizen.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensified aroma and improved colour of dark ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensified aroma and improved colour of dark ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, pale
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Added at 5 to 10% aids head retention in all beers. Used up to 80% in wheat beers producing a slimmer, more sprightly beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, torrified
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmalted wheat .Typically used for Wits and other wheats where raw unmalted wheat is called for.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, red
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use as part or all of base malt in wheat beers. Often used in Hefeweizen and other traditional wheat styles due to a distinctive, characteristic wheat flour flavor. Improves head and foam retention in any beer style.
